Expected Result: Address wraps correctly within burst boundary

Description: FIXED burst write (same address for all transfers)
Expected Result: All transfers target same address

Expected Result: Each burst type behaves correctly in parallel

Description: Verify M0 cannot send transactions to multiple slaves simultaneously
Expected Result: Only one transaction active per master at a time

Description: Attempt back-to-back transactions to different slaves from same master
Expected Result: Second transaction blocked until first completes

Description: Verify response phase completion before new transaction initiation
Expected Result: New transaction only starts after B/R response received

Description: Test that interleaving is not allowed between different slaves
Expected Result: Strict sequential execution per master

Description: Multiple transactions with same ID from same master to same slave
Expected Result: Transactions complete in submission order

Description: Multiple transactions with different IDs from same master to same slave
Expected Result: Transactions can complete in different order than submission

Description: Same master with mixed ID patterns (some same some different)
Expected Result: Same ID transactions maintain order different ID can reorder

Description: Multiple masters with overlapping ID ranges
Expected Result: Each master's ordering rules maintained independently

Description: Ordering maintained during slave contention scenarios
Expected Result: Ordering rules preserved even with round-robin arbitration

Description: Test burst length > 15 (should cause protocol violation)
Expected Result: Protocol violation detected for invalid burst length

Description: Test unaligned addresses for different transfer sizes
Expected Result: Address alignment violations properly handled
